document_data.name: Saarvin
document_data.mainbody:
'''Saarvin''', the self-titled '''King of Frozenfar''', was a [[dragonborn]] [[adventurer]] of [[gold dragon]] descent who wandered the lands of [[the North]] and the [[Sword Coast North]], protecting others during the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|Maybe one day you can explore a less treacherous land. There's an expansive world out there with so much beauty...and a lot less snow. Who knows where our adventures will take us.|Saarvin, about the realms beyond Icewind Dale.}}
document_data.Personality: Saarvin was quite enthusiastic and boastful, and often shared fantastic stories of his exploits with his fellow travelers.{{Cite comic/Frost Giant's Fury 1|19}}
document_data.Possessions:
[[File:Dragon_bow_WoW.png|thumb|''A bow and arrow carved by Saarvin himself from the bones of a white dragon.]]Saarvin fought with [[bow]] and [[arrow]]s,

During his time in [[Waterdeep]] Saarvin owned several magical arms, such as the [[enchanted]] bow ''[[Outlander]]'' and the unique ''[[axes of the slicing storm]]''. He also owned several magical items, including a pair of ''[[bracers of archery]]'', ''[[gloves of accuracy]]'', the ''[[eyes of the hunter]]'', an ''[[amulet of true strikes]]'', and the ''[[seal of guidance]]''. He also had armor fashioned from the scales and hide of a [[white dragon]], as well as a mighty bow he had crafted from a white dragon jawbone with arrows carved from the teeth. He used these trophies to support his boasts about journeys through the [[Spine of the World]].
document_data.Abilities:
{{Quote|If we took the normal path it would take three days to reach the top! This trail is faster and more treacherous.|Saarvin, enthusiastic about the prospect of imminent doom.}}

Saarvin was an experienced outdoorsman and quite knowledgeable about the frost-covered lands of the [[Icewind Dale]] and the [[Frozenfar]].{{Fact}} He was also a proficient hunter and tracker. In battle, he had a knack for outmaneuvering his opponents.
document_data.Relationships:
[[File:Saarvin Runa.png|thumb|right|400px|''Saarvin and his adventuring companion [[Runa]].'']]
The high-spirited wilderness guide had many friends across the North and [[Sword Coast North|Sword Coast]], including [[Dasharra Keldabar]] the [[griffon]]-rider, the adventurers [[Minsc]] and [[Delina]],{{Cite comic/Frost Giant's Fury 2|18}} and the [[druid]] [[Belvyre]] of [[Bryn Shander]].

He forged a close bond with the [[Uthgardt]] barbarian [[Runa]]. While Runa originally felt indebted to Saarvin for saving her life, he felt it an act of honor between two protectors of the North.{{Cite comic/At the Spine of the World 2|1-2}}

At one time, Saarvin traveled the [[Waterdeep]] on the [[Sword Coast North]] to search for new friends and new challenges, and began performing missions on behalf of [[Open Lord]] [[Laeral Silverhand]]. During this time he developed a good-natured but mildly antagonistic relationship with [[Mirt]], with the two finding ways to mock each other.

History.Guide For Adventurers: Some time during the 1480s DR, Saarvin came to the aid of the [[Heroes of Baldur's Gate]] when they were ambushed by [[ogre]]s.{{Cite comic/Frost Giant's Fury 1|15-18}} Shortly after their meeting, Saarvin fought alongside the heroes in defense of Fireshear, when it was threated by [[Gryttmort]] and his [[frost giant]].{{Cite comic/Frost Giant's Fury 2|8-11}} After the giants were defeated, Saarvin used his extensive knowledge of the trails along [[Cold Crag Peak]] to guide the heroes{{Cite comic/Frost Giant's Fury 3|5-9}} to the lair of [[Nilanthe]], the white dragon.{{Cite comic/Frost Giant's Fury 3|12-15}} To save Fireshear, Saarvin and the heroes soared to the fortress of [[Svardborg]],{{Cite comic/Frost Giant's Fury 4|3-10}} and recovered the lost ''[[orb of dragonkind]]'' that was stolen by the giants.{{Cite comic/Frost Giant's Fury 5|14-17}}

document_data.Rumors & Legends: Saarvin claimed to have climbed the tallest peak in the Spine of the World mountain range and stolen from the hoard of a white dragon, while it slumbered mere feat away.
